name: La Quinta Inn & Suites Seattle Sea-Tac

reviews.text: I arrived with my family at 3:00 AM due to a delayed flight, and we were told that our booking (through Expedia) was not received by La Quinta Inns (SEA-TAC). We were treated to a rude welcome by the night receptionist who gave us a lecture on what we should do next time to avoid situations like this. We were standing there with a sick six-year old in the middle of the night, listening to the receptionist's comments and not knowing whether we would have a place to sleep. The proper way to handle this would have been to re-assure us that a room is available and that any problems with our reservation could be sorted out the next day (I had a hard copy of the reservation with me and the receptionist saw that it was already paid in full and it was for the correct date and La Quinta location).
reviews.title: Mixed experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I also want to note that our stay was otherwise fine, I liked the free wireless AND wired Internet connection (there are some security issues with wireless access in some hotels), the day staff were courteous and tried to resolve the issues as quickly as they could. I also complained to La Quinta through their website, and they seemed pretty responsive. The place was clean and was very convenient for a one night stay flying into Seattle and then driving on the next day. (Note: from what I can tell, the lost booking was La Quinta's fault, but they are still looking into the issue.)
reviews.title: Very good hotel if flying out of Seatac

reviews.text: La Quinta is a well located, quiet, and clean hotel. We had a noon flight from the airport to the East Coast and needed a good night's sleep. The hotel sits next to the airport but it must be well insulated because we did not hear the noise of planes. Personnel was friendly and accommodating; price was reasonable; all necessary amenities provided. Very good hotel!
reviews.title: Nice place! Clean and quiet, free internet

likes.liked: — Wonderful front desk service, cleanliness, comfy beds, high speed internet
likes.disliked: — No fridge or microwave, no handicapped entrance on one side of the lobby

reviews.text: The airport La Quinta is a really nice hotel! I am a budget traveler and usually stay at the Red Roof Inn or the Motel 6, so that gives you an idea of my expectations and standards. We splurged on a Monday night at the La Quinta because we needed internet access and the Red Roof was full. I'm so glad we got to spend the night in comparative luxury. The La Quinta was renovated about two years ago and everything is new and shiny, from the tile in the bathroom to the paint in the hallways. Either it was deserted or the walls are thick, because we didn't hear evidence of another guest the whole time in our room. We heard airplanes in the morning, which is to be expected since the hotel is right next to the airport, but they sounded much quieter than they do from the Red Roof or Motel 6. High-speed internet was furnished via in-room cable and worked great with no passwords or connection fees required. The room was ultra clean. There was a blow dryer, shampoo, and a coffee maker in the room, as well as a desk, but no fridge or microwave--those would have been the icing on the cake. The front desk staff was friendly and solicitous--they even called when we'd been in our room a few minutes to make sure everything was satisfactory. There was plenty of parking and this hotel really is right next to the airport, though a few blocks' drive from the airport entrance. One small problem is that the wheelchair/stroller entrance is only on the airport-facing side of the lobby, so if you need to enter on wheels (or wheel your luggage in) you have to drive around to that side of the hotel, and it's not obvious that this would be necessary from the parking lot.
reviews.title: Great value if you can get their weekend rate!

reviews.text: The hotel is situated on the "hotel strip" just next to the airport, and there are several restaurants nearby. The closest stores include a Jack-In-The-Box, a Taco Bell, two gas stations, and a 7-Eleven, but I also saw a bunch of sit-down restaurants further down the street toward the airport. We didn't have a chance to check out the continental breakfast or the pool.
reviews.title: Well above Average and my expectations

reviews.text: I am currently staying at the LQ Seattle Airport res and today is 1.31.08.
reviews.title: Stuck in the Elevator....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've just spent the last 40 min in a stuck elevator...here is a recap of the experience:
reviews.title: Great One-Nighter

likes.disliked: — Printer in Lobby out of Ink so couldn't print boarding passes

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon determining that the elevator was actually stuck I attempted to use the “call” button in the unit…simply to hear it ring through, be answered and hung up…
reviews.title: I'd stay again

reviews.text: I finally got through to the front desk on my cell phone….where I was told to “push some more buttons….that usually works”. As I told them that I had already done that and that the buttons were just staying lit up…they simply indicated “I can’t take this again”…..from there I was disconnected.
reviews.title: Dependable

reviews.text: At this point I called 911 where they patched me through to the front desk again and with the operator they indicated “they were working on it”…and again was hung up on.
reviews.title: less than average

reviews.text: I have tried about 8 hotels at the Seattle airport and am still looking for one which is inexpensive but nice. This one was ok but I'm still looking.
reviews.title: Ordinary / average
It was okay . . .
reviews.text: The location is very convenient to the airport and there is are 2 restaurants across the street. The room was big but the bed was a bit hard and the blanket way too thin. The pillows were flat and hard. The bathroom was average size and the towels were thin and very scratchy.

reviews.title: cough cough ughh smokers on 6th floor and dirty rooms
reviews.text: Everything was very clean. The desk staff are friendly. Free internet (dls plug) in the room.

The free breakfast was your average continental breakfast: toast, bagels with tasteless cream cheese, a few cereals, yogurt, emply plate from what was hard boiled eggs, terrible coffee, the milk (I opened 2 indiviual serving size containers) and gone bad but I saw other people drinking and using it, toaster waffles, packaged muffins, etc.
reviews.title: I could hear the guy belching in the next room.

reviews.text: Free shutte to the airport every 30 minutes.
reviews.title: great place to stay, especially if you have pets!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we needed a hotel close to the seattle airport, and free breakfast was the inducement. the room was sparkling. not a smudge on the walls or mirrors could be seen. the wake up call was right on time, and the shuttle to the airport left on schedule. breakfast was adequate. no frills at all, however.
reviews.title: clean but spartan

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrived at La Quinta evening prior to an Alaskan Cruise. Free airport shuttle and clean rooms. Best part about this hotel was the location. Very short walking distance to a liquor store which sold wine (to take on the cruise). Also were able to take advantage of local transportation (Seattle Express) to the cruise terminal...they picked us up ten minutes before our scheduled time, and the front desk staff called our room to let us know they had arrived. Seattle hotels can be a bit pricey, so we were thrilled to have stumbled upon this value hotel through hotwire.
reviews.title: Convenient Overnight Hotel prior to Cruise

reviews.text: The good - the hotel is easy to access from I-5, rooms are nice and spacious, staff is friendly and accomodating on check in, great pet policy, double windows keep SeaTac noise out, felt entirely safe in the location.
reviews.title: Good hotel, poor customer service

likes.disliked: — Manner the staff used to resolve an issue

reviews.text: The bad - the stay was great. A billing snafu went from snafu to ugly as 'good customer service' appears to only apply when there are no problems. Their response was so over the top, I really thought their message was fake.
reviews.title: Close to Airport & Comfortable

reviews.text: Overall, the hotel is good, management in my opinion, needs a few more sessions in maintaining customer relations to avoid poisoning the brand.
reviews.title: Great location for air travelers
